intro: Dichapetalum edule, commonly known as the edible milk tree, is a shrub native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers followed by capsule fruits containing seeds. Its bark and leaves have been traditionally used for their medicinal properties. The plant is notable for its ability to thrive in arid environments, making it an important resource in regions with limited vegetation.
